name: Frank-th
tagline: What source is better than tomato sauce?
body:
I've been an open source newbie for eight years.

Time to stick my toe in the water.

I am dabbling with html 5, css and javascript.

I am meddling with c++ and am getting to grips with namespace errors.

I like to fiddle around in MYSQL/Maria DB and have to run the only os for me... linux.

I was devastated about the announcement of "the h" blog being discontinued and would like to help in the production of anything new in the pipeline. Frank tries ... what did he break this time?

I recently moved from Ubuntu through to Mint and then back to Debian.

Is there anyone out there who might be interested in forming a blogging group?

If you want to publish a blog like this follow the instructions attached;

https://help.github.com/articles/creating-pages-with-the-automatic-generator

Then head over to;

http://www.git-scm.com/book

There is a lovely guide I am going to evolve my understanding of this platform with.

Don't forget to https://flattr.com/ them if you do use the manual, would  you leave a taxi without a tip, this should get you further ;0)?
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
